alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 11:00AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Humboldt River Above Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:55 AM PDT Friday, June 02 the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:55 AM PDT Friday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday at 1200 PM PDT.
